title: Top NFL Draft prospect Fernando Mendoza enthralled by possibility of Tom Brady mentorship: ‘It would mean so much’
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Fernando Mendoza, potential No. 1 pick in 2026 NFL Draft, excited about possible mentorship with Tom Brady.
Mendoza, Heisman Trophy winner, completed pre-draft interview with Brady's Las Vegas Raiders; spoke with Brady by phone.
Mendoza, key in Indiana's turnaround, threw for 3,535 yards and 41 touchdowns last season.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Kiss of the Spider Woman' featuring Jennifer Lopez is available on Hulu, based on a Tony Award-winning musical.
'Paul McCartney: Man on the Run' explores McCartney's post-Beatles career, streaming on Prime Video.
'Bridgerton' Season 4 focuses on character Benedict Bridgerton, available now on Netflix.

title: Red Sox’ Roman Anthony and Ceddanne Rafaela say they’re fine after outfield collision
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Red Sox outfielders Roman Anthony and Ceddanne Rafaela collided during a spring training game against the Atlanta Braves.
Both players received medical attention but continued playing, with Anthony hitting a single and Rafaela hitting a two-run homer.
The collision was attributed to miscommunication while tracking a fly ball; both players reported being fine after the game.

title: Alex Cora to donate $20K to Jimmy Fund when 2026 Red Sox hit this milestone
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Alex Cora pledges $20K donation to the Jimmy Fund when a Red Sox player hits 20 home runs in 2026.
Cora's donation will be his largest public contribution to the Jimmy Fund, supporting cancer research at Dana-Farber.
Cora's past pledges included donations based on wins and runs; $20K pledge linked to home run milestone for 2026.

title: N.H. House advances bill targeting ‘indoctrination’ in public schools
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: The New Hampshire House passed the CHARLIE Act, restricting teachings on critical race theory and LGBTQ+ issues in public schools.
House Bill 1792 passed with a 184-164 vote, moving to the Senate for further consideration, with mostly Republican support.
Violations of the bill could lead to educator discipline and lawsuits against schools, with fines up to $10,000 per violation.

title: The story behind these colorful icicles in the Berkshires
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Colorful icicles on Route 2 in North Adams are created by adding food coloring to ice.
This city tradition has been ongoing for decades with locals using supersoakers or water balloons.
The Hairpin Turn, a scenic spot on the Mohawk Trail, offers views of Hoosac Valley and nearby mountains.

title: Mass. reports first two measles cases of 2026, including one in Greater Boston
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Massachusetts confirms first two measles cases of 2026: a Greater Boston adult and a school-aged child.
The adult case recently returned from abroad and visited multiple locations, exposing possibly others to measles.
The U.S. faces a significant measles outbreak in 2026, with 1,136 cases nationwide per CDC data.

title: Local obituary: Morgan Mallard-Vitiello, 33, lifelong South Boston resident and mother of 2
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Morgan Mallard-Vitiello, 33, a lifelong South Boston resident, passed away peacefully on February 21, 2026, surrounded by family.
Morgan was known for her work at the City of Boston Inspectional Services and her appearance in a Dunkin’ Donuts commercial.
She is survived by her husband, Francis Vitiello, her children, Mya and Frankie, and a large extended family.

title: She’s running Boston for The ALS Association in memory of her dad
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Lauren Hamilton, 26, from Tampa, Florida, is running the 2026 Boston Marathon in memory of her father.
Hamilton's father, who worked as a salesman in Boston, passed away from ALS when she was 25 years old.
She aims to raise awareness for ALS and honor her father's legacy through her participation in the marathon.

title: DiZoglio files emergency motion after AG Campbell moves to strike down audit lawsuit
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: State Auditor Diana DiZoglio filed an emergency motion with the Supreme Judicial Court challenging AG Andrea Campbell's move to strike her audit lawsuit.
DiZoglio's lawsuit seeks to compel Massachusetts legislative leaders to comply with an audit supported by a 2024 voter-approved ballot measure.
AG Campbell argues DiZoglio lacks authority to file the lawsuit and dismisses the auditor's complaint as an attempt to bypass her office's approval.
